New Records: Freddie Freeman hit the first game-ending grand slam in World Series history.
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman hit a walk-off grand slam in the 10th inning to give the Dodgers a 6-3 victory.
Anthony Volpe grounded into a fielder's choice to score Jazz Chisholm Jr. and give the Yankees a 3-2 lead in the top of the 10th inning.
Jazz Chisholm Jr. stole two bases to set up the go-ahead run for the Yankees.
Alex Verdugo made a running catch in foul territory, advancing both Dodgers runners one base due to the dead ball rule.
Post-Match Reflections: Freddie Freeman expressed joy and pride, especially sharing the moment with his father.
Freddie Freeman mentioned feeling good after recovering from his ankle injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the third straight World Series opener to go into extra innings.
Nestor Cortes, who had not pitched since September 18 due to an elbow injury, was added to the World Series roster and pitched in the 10th inning.
